meanings.definition: Covered with or resembling a thin layer of film
meanings.sent1: The window looked filmier after I sprayed it with glass cleaner.
meanings.sent2: The old photograph became even filmier with age.
meanings.sent3: The mirror was so filmier that it looked like a ghost was standing behind it.
meanings.sent4: The mist made the forest appear filmier, like a magical veil over the trees.
meanings.sent5: The filmier surface of the pond reflected the sky like a mirror.

meanings.definition: Having a thin or delicate texture
meanings.sent1: The silk scarf felt filmier than the cotton one.
meanings.sent2: Her delicate skin felt even filmier after applying moisturizer.
meanings.sent3: The cake was so filmier that it almost melted in my mouth.
meanings.sent4: The filmier fabric of the dress made it flow gracefully in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The filmier petals of the flower made it seem like a fragile work of art.

meanings.definition: To become covered with a thin layer of film
meanings.sent1: If you leave the dishes unwashed, they will filmier overnight.
meanings.sent2: The water in the vase started to filmier after a few days.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally let the soup filmier in the pot, and it was a pain to clean.
meanings.sent4: Leaving the car unwashed for too long will cause it to filmier with dirt.
meanings.sent5: The neglected aquarium began to filmier, creating a murky environment for the fish.
